full_text: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZB DATE: 7/29/19 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 12:30- 1:00 AM 1:00-1:30 AM 1:30-2:00 AM 2:00-2:30 AM 2:30-3:00 AM 3:00-3:30 AM 3:30-4:00 AM 4:00-4:30 AM 4:30-5:00 AM 5:00 -5:30 AM 5:30-6:00 AM 6:00-6:30 AM 6:30-7:00 AM 7:00-7:30 AM 7:30-8:00 AM 12 11 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 29 124 170 204 235 304 330 335 440 445 505 510 530 535 600 605 640 645 700 705 731 7? 8:00-8:30 AM 8:30- 9:00 AM 9:00-9:30 AM 9:30-10:00 AM 10:00-10:30 AM 10:30-11:00 AM 11:00-11:30 AM 11:30-12:00 AM 12:00-12:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 PM 1:00-1:30 PM 1:30-2:00 PM 2:00-2:30 PM 2:30-3:00 PM 3:00-3:30 PM 3:30-4:00 PM 905 815 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 845 848 913 915 937 939 1020 1022 1051 1053 1101 1104 1141 1144 1216 1219 1243 1247 123 124 136 135 202 204 727 740 715 717 315 319 4:00-4:30 PM 4:30-5:00 PM 5:00 -5:30 PM 5:30-6:00 PM 6:00-6:30 PM 6:30-7:00 PM 7:00-7:30 PM 7:30-8:00 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 8:30- 9:00 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 11:30-12:00 PM 401 403 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 436 439 513 514 542 545 615 618 654 657 719 722 748 751 802 805 837 840 911 914 940 943 1000 1003 1031 1034 1113 1116 1142 1145 MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN
